commit.commit_title: Fix â€œScoped order is ignored, it's forced to be batch order.â€ warnings (#26793)

prs.pr_title: Fix â€œScoped order is ignored, it's forced to be batch order.â€ warnings
prs.pr_body:
Those warnings are because some default or composed scopes include an ordering, but `in_batches` and so on cannot respect these orderings.

In our cases, the ordering is never important, so these warnings can be silenced by explicitly resetting the ordering.

Also changed the test environment to raise exceptions instead of displaying a warning, so these are easier to catch.

This migrates the Dockerfile to Debian Bookworm. The upstream Ruby image which the current Dockerfile depends on has been moved to Bookworm already, resulting in build errors as reported in Discord.

I have been using this configuration since around the release of Bookworm, and they fixed the errors reported.

- Changes Node to Bookworm image
- Changes libssl1.1 to libssl3
- Changes libidn11 to libidn12
- Changes libicu67 to libicu72

commit.commit_title: Add infinite scrolling for search results in web UI (#26784)

prs.pr_title: Add infinite scrolling for search results in web UI
prs.pr_body:
First of all, this resolves the issue where if you selected the quick action "Profiles matching..." or "Posts matching..." the results screen would show the "All" tab as selected. Now it will show the correct tab, and clicking *other* tabs will re-run the search query to display the appropriate results (vs showing a blank screen as previously). I've increased the number of results per page from 5 to 10, except now I'm also doing peeking (querying for 11 and using the extra item to determine if there's a next page or not). When a specific search type is selected, we now use infinite scroll. On the "all" page, this is not possible, and "Load more" buttons are displayed under each section as before. Clicking one of them will switch you to the tab and enable infinite scroll.

In the advanced web UI, I've removed the result count from the search panel (it was showing the number of rendered results, which increased every time you clicked "Load more"--I don't think that's super valuable, and a little deceiving). I've also removed the flash of suggested accounts while search results were loading. It would be nice if we could surface the *actual* hit count from Elasticsearch to the UI, but that's a whole another story.

![Screenshot 2023-09-05 at 03-17-57 Localhost](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/184731/4b540cd4-1fca-430f-8515-8afab71e78ca)

commit.commit_title: Do not truncate backtrace when the `BACKTRACE` env variable is set (#26794)

prs.pr_title: Do not truncate backtrace when the `BACKTRACE` env variable is set
prs.pr_body: Backtrace silencers can be disabled by setting the `BACKTRACE` environment variable, but that results in mostly useless sidekiq traces as only the first 3 lines are kept. This PR fixes it by changing our middleware not to truncate traces when `BACKTRACE` is set.

issues.issue_title: Feature request: List time zone alongside time in emails
issues.issue_body:
### Motivation

In the Mastodon preferences, my timezone is blank. Because of this, emails ("you got a mention" notification emails; "Your account has been accessed from a new IP address" use times from a mystery timezone. I assume it is UTC, which I assume is server time.

Receiving emails with times in UTC is fine, and if I have left my timezone blank, it is surely the most reasonable thing for the server to do. **However**, the problem is that when I look at an email I *don't know* what the timezone is.

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/277318/112ad2c7-8393-44df-b829-6279ae70075f)

If I am in my email client I of course won't remember what I have my timezone prefs set to over on Mastodon. At the moment I read that email, what "20:19" means is a total mystery.

### Pitch

One of the following:

1. When an email lists a time, it should always explicitly mention the time zone ("UTC" or other).
2. When an email lists a time, it should always explicitly mention the time zone *if the user has a blank time zone in their preferences*.

I would prefer (1) because, even if I set my time zone to the city where I live, imagine if I went traveling. I would not have a way to be sure, if I am in Germany and I receive an email with a time, that that email is US East Coast time. But you could argue most users, if they set a time zone, you can assume they always want to communicate in that time zone and will know what time zone they set.

However, if the user has *not* set a time zone, then definitely it would be helpful to specify because the user can't figure it out by double-checking their prefs.

commit.commit_title: Change DCT method used for JPEG encoding to float (#26675)

prs.pr_title: Change DCT method used for JPEG encoding to float

Fix #26674

issues.issue_title: Vertical banding aligned with JPEG blocks due to image-magick defaults
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. upload a photograph with some ISO noise and large smooth areas
2. observe vertical banding in the resulting image, frequently made worse when re-processed by a second server


### Expected behaviour

Image should not have vertical banding

### Actual behaviour

Visible degredation of image quality

### Detailed description

There is an 8 pixel wide vertical striping effect on all images that are re-compressed on mastodon. In some images it is particularly visible, namely photographs with large smooth areas with a medium to large amount of ISO noise

### Mastodon instance

all

### Mastodon version

all that I've seen including latest

### Technical details

This isn't something everyone can see easily without some prompting, so to verify the phenomena and eliminate my bias I performed quantitative analysis with an FFT using [this little program](https://github.com/electroCutie/vertical_banding) I put together

It takes the FFT in either the horizontal (default) or vertical (--transpose) axis for every line (or column) and then sums the complex output of the FFT (so not just magnitude but also phase).
This cancels out any non-correlated signal because the phases line to line will be largely uncorrelated and so will tend towards the noise floor. Any remaining value above the noise floor will be a feature of the image along the axis orthogonal to the axis of the FFT.

The program spits a few thousands lines with the wavelength and the normalized magnitude of the FFT sum at that wavelength. This can be plotted with GNU Plot or any office software.
My gnu plot command is `plot "fft.xy" with lines`

To save you the trouble of running it here are the results from a random image (first example below) taken from the hashtag photography timeline, zoomed in to the area of the plot which shows the banding signal
![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/26614496/651d398a-ab3f-41dd-8b78-46c7481dba93)
> Note the extremely large spike at the 8 pixel wavelength, that is the vertical banding

Most images show something similar. A prominent spike at the 8 pixel wavelength. For me this is a frequently visible visual defect and it gets worse when the image is transferred to a new server and re-encoded. There is no such spike in the other axis.

Some examples from the photography hashtag
https://sfba.social/@pinskal/110955776597892946
https://mstdn.social/@bryanhansel/110953023808476859
https://chaos.social/@kernpanik/110952673882054199

(please do not contact these users, I merely grabbed a few examples from the photography hashtag)

I've tracked down the bug to an image-magick behavior and reproduced this error with the image-magick command line tool and even in the GnuIMP program. The error is caused by a slight bias in the DCT method called "Fast Integer" in GnuIMP or just "fastest" in image-magick

Confusingly in image-magick the default is "fastest" and **not** the so-called "default" DCT method (in GnuIMP called the Integer method)

We can ask image-magick to use the integer (or even better the floating point) method by adding a command line option 
`-define jpeg:dct-method=default`
or
`-define jpeg:dct-method=`

I've identified a location in the mastodon source code where this fix may be applied but I am not well versed in the mastodon codebase and so I'll make a pull request attached to this bug report and ask someone that both knows the codebase and can test it check it for me.

issues.issue_title: Fix "Cannot read property" on missing status
issues.issue_body:
I've found this issue when I open UserA's status which replies to UserB whom I blocked/muted.

Properties I've removed in here were added with lazy loading using IntersectionObserver (8e4d1cba), but those statuses are not need to be tracked anyway because it will be rendered as only empty div.

prs.pr_body:
This involves two changes, each with potential:
- the directory will only return accounts with an `account_stats` record, but this should only affect accounts that never had any known post, local follower, or local followee
- this introduces an index on `last_status_at`, which is probably the most-updated column of `account_stats`, so there may be performance concerns; however, adding this index on mastodon.social's database had no measurable negative effect on performances, so this is unlikely to be an issue at our scale

The latest Webpack 4 version properly supports Node 18+.

Node 16 is out of support next week, so let's upgrade to Node 20, which will be the LTS version starting in October.

The `compression-webpack-plugin` version 6 (the last major version compatible with Webpack 4) still uses the `crypto` module to compute MD4 hashes, so I forked it to use the new MD4 hash function from Webpack instead. My fork can be replaced if a new v6 version is published upstream (related issue: https://github.com/webpack-contrib/compression-webpack-plugin/issues/364).

prs.pr_title: Fix `account_id`, `max_id` and `min_id` params not working in search
prs.pr_body:
Fix #26837

These parameters should be considered deprecated, but since they were documented, they can't be removed yet. This also fixes `before:"0000-00-00 00:00:00"` not being properly matched due to the colons in the phrase.

issues.issue_title: The account_id parameter of the search API is not supported
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

Call the search API with an account_id parameter.

### Expected behaviour

`/api/v2/search` supports `account_id` parameter

### Actual behaviour

It seems that the `/api/v2/search` `account_id` parameter is no longer supported since v4.2 beta 3.

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Mastodon instance

mastodon.social

### Mastodon version

v4.2.0-nightly.2023-09-06

### Technical details

_No response_

prs.pr_body:
Similar to https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/25461

This PR adds a way to write search tests. It implements a rather straightforward simple test as a POC. 

The process for this dedicated search test suite is:
- Before ANY test runs
1. Populate the rails DBâ€™s with some seed data
- Before EVERY test runs
1. Create every ES index
2. Take the seeded data and import into ES
- After EVERY test runs
1. Delete every ES index
- After ALL tests run
1. Delete all seeded data

prs.pr_title: Fix confusing behavior of mute button and volume slider in web UI
prs.pr_body:
Follow-up to #26827

- allows moving the volume slider to unmute the audio/video
- clicking the unmute button when volume is at 0 brings back the volume to 0.5
- unmuting when volume is below 0.05 reverts volume to 0.05 so there is a visible difference

issues.issue_title: Sometimes '...' dropdown actions in expanded view appear outside the bottom of the screen
issues.issue_body:
Depending on the content, you may be able to see these actions by scrolling down after clicking the '...' (in my experience this worked for replies, but not for the main toot). Example below:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/569607/23168301/a135ac02-f83f-11e6-8d17-5d600d7d51fd.png)

issues.issue_title: #467 â€“ Making the back button a little smarter
issues.issue_body: If the length of `window.history` is `1` then there isn't anywhere to `goBack()` to, and the back button just takes you to `/`.

### [`v7.0.8`](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/releases/tag/v7.0.8): 7.0.8

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/compare/v7.0.7...v7.0.8)

#### Active Support

-   Fix `TimeWithZone` still using deprecated `#to_s` when `ENV` or `config` to
    disable it are set.

    *Hartley McGuire*

-   Fix CacheStore#write_multi when using a distributed Redis cache with a connection pool.

    Fixes [#​48938](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/issues/48938).

    *Jonathan del Strother*

#### Active Model

-   No changes.

#### Active Record

-   Fix `change_column` not setting `precision: 6` on `datetime` columns when
    using 7.0+ Migrations and SQLite.

    *Hartley McGuire*

-   Fix unscope is not working in specific case

    Before:

    ```ruby
    Post.where(id: 1...3).unscope(where: :id).to_sql # "SELECT `posts`.* FROM `posts` WHERE `posts`.`id` >= 1 AND `posts`.`id` < 3"

    ```

    After:

    ```ruby
    Post.where(id: 1...3).unscope(where: :id).to_sql # "SELECT `posts`.* FROM `posts`"
    ```

    Fixes [#​48094](https://togithub.com/rails/rails/issues/48094).

    *Kazuya Hatanaka*

-   Fix associations to a STI model including a `class_name` parameter

    ```ruby
    class Product < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :requests, as: :requestable, class_name: "ProductRequest", dependent: :destroy
    end
    ```

### STI tables

    class Request < ApplicationRecord
      belongs_to :requestable, polymorphic: true

      validate :request_type, presence: true
    end

    class ProductRequest < Request
      belongs_to :user
    end
    ```

    Accessing such association would lead to:

    ```
    table_metadata.rb:22:in `has_column?': undefined method `key?' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError)
    ```

    *Romain Filinto*

-   Fix `change_table` setting datetime precision for 6.1 Migrations

    *Hartley McGuire*

-   Fix change_column setting datetime precision for 6.1 Migrations

    *Hartley McGuire*

#### Action View

-   Fix `form_for` missing the hidden `_method` input for models with a
    namespaced route.

    *Hartley McGuire*

-   Fix `render collection: @​records, cache: true` inside `jbuilder` templates

    The previous fix that shipped in `7.0.7` assumed template fragments are always strings,
    this isn't true with `jbuilder`.

    *Jean Boussier*

#### Action Pack

-   Fix `HostAuthorization` potentially displaying the value of the
    X_FORWARDED_HOST header when the HTTP_HOST header is being blocked.

    *Hartley McGuire*, *Daniel Schlosser*

#### Active Job

-   Fix Active Job log message to correctly report a job failed to enqueue
    when the adapter raises an `ActiveJob::EnqueueError`.

    *Ben Sheldon*

#### Action Mailer

-   No changes.

#### Action Cable

-   No changes.

#### Active Storage

-   No changes.

#### Action Mailbox

-   No changes.

#### Action Text

-   No changes.

-   Omit `webdrivers` gem dependency from `Gemfile` template

    *Sean Doyle*

This is an example of how to use `createAppSyncThunk` from RTK ([documentation](https://redux-toolkit.js.org/api/createAsyncThunk)) to avoid boilerplate when creating actions that query the API while being fully typed.

This function create 3 actions, in this case:
- `submitAccountNote.pending`
- `submitAccountNote.fulfilled`
- `submitAccountNote.rejected`

It avoids creating them by hand and makes the code much simpler. It could probably be simplified further by having a custom action creator, but this will be for later as I am not yet sure of the best way to implement API requests yet.

Before converting the action into Typescript, I converted `mastodon/api` (easy, as it was already near-correctly typed using JSDoc`).

I also split `store/` into multiple files, to allow importing `createAppAsyncThunk` without creating circular dependencies.

commit.commit_title: Fix recent search items not handling overflows correctly (#26893)

prs.pr_title: Fix recent search items not handling overflows correctly
prs.pr_body:
Currently, if an item in recent searches is too long (this happens frequently when looking up a remote toot by its URL, for example), the overflow isn't correctly handled, making the cross button at the right not visible.

![Screenshot 2023-09-11 221300](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/36609914/6b48598e-b612-441b-a362-d080e7e8e30b)
![Screenshot 2023-09-11 222404](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/36609914/763e759c-eb82-4d5c-840c-6adb00bd8e16)

`overflow` and `text-overflow` rules are set for the parent, but not inherited by `<span>`. This PR fixes that.
![Screenshot 2023-09-11 222521](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/36609914/9c3f1df9-3f0b-4ea2-8b51-f77f741bc0a6)
![Screenshot 2023-09-11 222554](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/36609914/39eab351-5b12-4828-a29c-7ff5249c9cc2)
![Screenshot 2023-09-11 223711](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/36609914/cd57a5c0-c52a-4605-bca5-f600935304dc)

commit.commit_title: Fix #26849 by adding the domain of the current SSO provider to the form-action CSP (#26857)

prs.pr_title: Fix #26849 by adding the domain of the current SSO provider to the form-action CSP
prs.pr_body:
Fixes #26849

Without the SSO provider in form-action CSP, a browser will reject the redirect to the SSO provider after clicking on the 'Login or Register' button introduced by #26083.

The CSP header on instances not using a single SSO method as their sole authentication method should remain unaltered.

issues.issue_title: When OMNIAUTH_ONLY=true the web interface stuck and cannot log in v4.2.0
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Use the latest nightly docker image
2. In the env, set `OMNIAUTH_ONLY=true` because I am using OIDC login and it works well
3. Run `docker compose up -d` and you will see that you stuck on the page you are in
4. The problem never happens on 4.1.7 or earlier version

### Expected behaviour

It should not be stuck and when you click log in you will be able to see the login page with a single button log in with the OAuth

### Actual behaviour

It will stuck on the page

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Mastodon instance

mfy.social

### Mastodon version

v4.2.0 Nightly

### Browser name and version

Edge Latest

### Operating system

macOS 13.5.1

### Technical details

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/blob/81caafbe84240bfb730f5001b33add97ebcbe9dc/spec/requests/content_security_policy_spec.rb#L20

I checked the detailed log and browser's console log, seems like this line is causing the problem? I am just guessing

issues.issue_title: Unexpected error while following someone or clicking the bell icon
issues.issue_body:

1. Open a users profile
2. Send a follow request

...


### Expected behaviour

Following users without any error message

### Actual behaviour

Successfully followed the user but displayed an error message saying "Unexpected error occurred". Also after clicking on the bell icon, notifications turns on without changing the status of the icon.

### Detailed description

When I follow someone or turn on notifications on my instance I get following error: 
![Screenshot_20230912-063102_Vivaldi Browser](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/114842102/5de7355d-2764-4076-87ee-ceff195d3891)

![SmartSelect_20230912-064148_Kiwi Browser](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/114842102/79c09449-cbab-41d0-8915-8419065ae71d)



### Mastodon instance

buddyverse.xyz

### Mastodon version

v4.2.0-beta3

### Browser name and version

Vivaldi Browser 6.2.3110.52, Brave 1.57.62, Chromium 116.0.5845.180, Firefox Mobile 117.0.1 (Build #2015971659)

Android 11; Build/RP1A.200720.012

commit.commit_title: Fix notification permissions being requested immediately after login (#26472)

prs.pr_title: Fix notification permissions being requested immediately after login
prs.pr_body:
Despite our intent to request notifications permission only on user action from the notification banner column, we missed the part where we were immediately registering push notifications through the service worker.

Only register push notifications at launch if the permission is already granted, otherwise, do that when the permission gets granted.

commit.commit_title: Added admin api for managing tags (#26872)

prs.pr_title: Added admin api for managing tags
prs.pr_body:
Adding an admin api for managing tags. This adds the `/api/v1/admin/tags` endpoint.
`GET /api/v1/admin/tags` returns a paginated list of all tags
`GET /api/v1/admin/tags/:id` returns a single tag
`PUT /api/v1/admin/tags/:id` updates a single tag using the following attributes:
- `display_name`: set the display name (changing the case)
- `trendable`: boolean: Allow this hashtag to appear under trends
- `usable`: boolean: Allow posts to use this hashtag
- `listable`: boolean: Allow this hashtag to appear in searches and suggestions

New Crowdin translations, automated with Github Actions

See `.github/workflows/crowdin-download.yml`

This PR will be updated every day with new translations.

Due to a limitation in Github Actions, checks are not running on this PR without manual action.
If you want to run the checks, then close and re-open it.

Noticed a few issues with #26857

The renaming of `omniauth.rb` is so that the initializers are executed before `content_security_policy.rb`, otherwise `Devise.omniauth_providers` would not be populated as expected.

cc @CSDUMMI

- Add some information about Full-text search being disabled in search popout ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26756))

- Change DCT method used for JPEG encoding to float ([electroCutie](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26675))
- Change onboarding prompt to use full width of banner in web UI ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26829))

### Removed

- Fix `account_id`, `max_id` and `min_id` params not working in search ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26847))

- Fix `#hashtag` matching on individual components in search ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26835))
- Fix mute button and volume slider feeling disconnected in web UI ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26827), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26860))
- Fix paragraph margins resulting in irregular read-more cut-off in web UI ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26828))
- Fix blocked domain appearing in account feeds ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26823))
- Fix moderator rights inconsistencies ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26729))
- Fix crash when encountering invalid URL ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26814))
- Fix signature verification debug logging using `warn` instead of `debug` ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26812))
- Fix interaction modal error handling ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26795))
- Fix video player not being displayed in reports interface ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26801))
- Fix â€œScoped order is ignored, it's forced to be batch order.â€ warnings ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26793))
